newsitem.title: USA: North Dakota floods force evacuation of 10,000.
newsitem.headline: North Dakota floods force evacuation of 10,000.

text.p: Rising floodwaters of the Red River burst through earth dikes on Saturday, swallowing more land, submerging hundreds of homes and forcing authorities to evacuate thousands more residents.
Authorities ordered evacuations in Grand Forks and across the river in East Grand Forks, Minn. Grand Forks Mayor Pat Owens asked for a voluntary evacuation of her entire city.
Officials estimated that at least 10,000 people had to be evacuated. There were no reports of serious injuries.
"We're evacuating various parts of the city as they become more prone," Grand Forks Police Lt. Dennis Eggebraaten said.

The river rose to 52.89 feet on Saturday at Grand Forks, nearly three feet above a record set in 1897 and more than 24 feet above flood level. The National Weather Service said it expected the Red River to crest at 54 feet later on Saturday.
